summary: MS-DOS, short for Microsoft Disk Operating System, was a popular computer operating system in the 1980s, mainly for IBM PC and compatible computers. It was developed by Microsoft and later licensed to IBM as PCÂ DOS. MS-DOS used text commands to run programs and manage files, stored on floppy disks. Over time, it added support for new storage types and processors. Though replaced by Windows, MS-DOS was crucial for Microsoft's growth and served as the foundation for early Windows versions. Its last update was in 2000.
title: MS-DOS
